segments.en: And today we're bringing you a very, I would say, embarrassing lesson for us men.
segments.cn: 今天我们要带来一个我认为对我们男性来说非常尴尬的课程。

segments.en: Right, embarrassing for men but I think it's okay for women.
segments.cn: 对，男性觉得尴尬，但我认为女性还好。

segments.en: That's right, we're going to be talking about buying underwear, specifically women's underwear.
segments.cn: 没错，我们要谈论的是购买内衣，特别是女性内衣。

segments.en: Right, so obviously not the favorite thing for men to do.
segments.cn: 对，所以显然这不是男性最喜欢做的事情。

segments.en: Well, apart from being a little bit uncomfortable, it's also boring.
segments.cn: 嗯，除了有点不舒服，这也很无聊。

segments.en: It involves shopping, so we're not really big on that.
segments.cn: 这涉及购物，所以我们并不太喜欢。

segments.en: Alright, but even though it might be a little bit of an uncomfortable topic, there is some great language in here, isn't there?
segments.cn: 好吧，尽管这可能是一个有点不舒服的话题，但这里有一些很好的语言，不是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, there's some really good words and, of course, the different types of underwear that we're going to be looking at.
segments.cn: 是的，有一些非常好的词汇，当然还有我们要看的不同类型的内衣。

segments.en: But we also have some words that we're going to take a look at before we get into our dialogue, so let's start with vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 但在进入对话之前，我们还有一些词要看看，所以让我们先来词汇预览。

segments.en: Well, we're going to look at two words that will appear in our dialogue, and the first one is lingerie.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们要看两个在对话中出现的词，第一个是内衣。

segments.en: Okay, so lingerie, this is a nice fancy word, basically for underwear, right?
segments.cn: 好的，内衣，这是一个很漂亮的词，基本上是指内衣，对吧？

segments.en: So lingerie, but it's very nice, very... Like pretty, sexy.
segments.cn: 所以内衣，但它非常好，非常……像漂亮、性感。

segments.en: Now the spelling of this word is interesting, isn't it?
segments.cn: 这个词的拼写很有趣，不是吗？

segments.en: Yes, don't you love English spellings?
segments.cn: 是的，你不喜欢英语的拼写吗？

segments.en: So, women's nice pretty sexy underwear.
segments.cn: 所以，女性漂亮性感的内衣。

segments.en: So this is a feeling that men have, especially when they're buying women's underwear.
segments.cn: 这是男性的感觉，尤其是在购买女性内衣时。

segments.en: Well, yeah, you feel a little bit uncomfortable, or it's a strange situation.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，你会感到有点不舒服，或者这是一个奇怪的情况。

segments.en: Or weird, or out of place.
All right, so we're going to be hearing both of these two words in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们将在对话中听到这两个词。

segments.en: Now, Marco, where are we here?
We're going to be at a department store at the section where they have women's lingerie, and we have a guy buying underwear for his girlfriend.
segments.cn: 我们将在百货商店的女性内衣区，有一个男士在为他的女朋友购买内衣。

segments.en: All right, well, let's find out what happens.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看会发生什么。

segments.en: Okay, just find something and get out of here.
segments.cn: 好吧，快找点东西然后离开这里。

segments.en: Oh no, don't come over here, don't come over here.
Um, I'm just having a look around.

segments.cn: 明天是我女朋友的生日。

segments.en: I'm trying to find her something.
Well, you can't give her granny panties.
segments.cn: 嗯，你不能给她买奶奶内裤。

segments.en: Have you thought about getting her some sleepwear?
segments.cn: 你有没有想过给她买睡衣？

segments.en: We've got these lovely silky nighties, or how about some nice panties and a bra set?
segments.cn: 我们有这些漂亮的丝质睡裙，或者一些漂亮的内裤和文胸套装？

segments.en: Look, here's a nice satin push-up bra, and you can choose a few different styles of undies to go with it.
segments.cn: 看，这里有一款漂亮的缎面推高文胸，你可以选择几种不同风格的内裤搭配。

segments.en: Well, do you want a thong?
Maybe this nice pair of Lacy boy shorts?
segments.cn: 也许这条漂亮的蕾丝男孩短裤？

segments.en: Just pick something and get the hell out of here.
segments.cn: 赶紧选点东西然后离开这里。

segments.en: Um, I'll go with these two.
I just want to get this over with, and she better thank me for those things.
segments.cn: 我只想快点结束，她最好为这些东西感谢我。

segments.en: I'm going to have to take a look inside your bag.
segments.cn: 我需要检查一下你的包。

segments.en: I was nervous, and of course it was very uncomfortable for him.
segments.cn: 我很紧张，当然这对他来说非常不舒服。

segments.en: I know, and then the security guard shows up.
segments.cn: 我知道，然后保安出现了。

segments.en: But we had the opportunity to take a look at some really great words and phrases, so let's start off with our first one in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 但我们有机会看看一些非常好的词汇和短语，所以让我们从我们的第一个语言收获开始。

segments.en: All right, we're going to look at words here that mostly have to do with underwear, describing underwear.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们要看一些主要与内衣有关的词，描述内衣。

segments.en: And the first one is granny panties.
This isn't like a real, real word, right?
segments.cn: 这不是一个真正的词，对吧？

segments.en: It's not something you'll find at a dictionary.
segments.cn: 这不是你会在字典里找到的东西。

segments.en: No, it's a slang word, and we use it to describe really big, ugly underwear like your grandmother would wear.
segments.cn: 不，这是一个俚语，我们用它来形容像你奶奶穿的那种非常大、丑的内裤。

segments.en: All right, so they're not like the sexy little underwear.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以它们不像性感的小内裤。

segments.en: It's more like long, and it's not very appealing.
segments.cn: 更像是长的，而且不太吸引人。

segments.en: Just picture what your grandmother would wear.
segments.cn: 想象一下你奶奶会穿什么。

segments.en: So obviously, this guy doesn't want to be buying any of those, but the saleswoman suggests that he try some sleepwear.
segments.cn: 显然，这个家伙不想买任何那些，但女售货员建议他试试一些睡衣。

segments.en: Obviously, clothes you wear when you're sleeping.
segments.cn: 显然，是你睡觉时穿的衣服。

segments.en: Now this is really interesting because men aren't really that complicated when it comes to sleeping.
segments.cn: 这真的很有趣，因为男性在睡觉时并不复杂。

segments.en: Just throw on a t-shirt and that's it.
Well, obviously for women there are more options and more different things you can choose from.
segments.cn: 很明显，女性有更多的选择和不同的东西可以选择。

segments.en: It's a whole separate category for women.
segments.cn: 这是一个完全独立的类别。

segments.en: Even when you're sleeping, you must wear something nice.
segments.cn: 即使在睡觉时，你也必须穿得好看。

segments.en: One type of sleepwear is silky nighties.
segments.cn: 一种睡衣是丝滑的睡裙。

segments.en: It's basically a dress that you wear when you sleep.
segments.cn: 基本上就是你睡觉时穿的裙子。

segments.en: Now the pronunciation is interesting because the first five letters are night.
segments.cn: 现在发音很有趣，因为前五个字母是night。

segments.en: Right, but you don't say night.
Yeah, you make the T a D.
Now she offered him some silky nighties.
segments.cn: 现在她给他提供了一些丝滑的睡裙。

segments.en: Obviously we know silk is a soft shiny fabric, right?
segments.cn: 显然我们知道丝绸是一种柔软光滑的面料，对吧？

segments.en: So when something is silky it's either made from silk or it's soft and shiny.
segments.cn: 所以当某物是丝滑的，它要么是用丝绸制成的，要么是柔软光滑的。
好的，所以一些丝滑的睡裙。

segments.en: Okay, what about our next word?
Well, the salesgirl offers different styles of undies.
segments.cn: 嗯，售货员提供不同款式的内衣。

segments.en: So undies is an interesting word.
segments.cn: 所以内衣是一个有趣的词。
它基本上是内裤的缩写。

segments.en: Okay, so you can just call underwear undies.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你可以把内裤叫做内衣。

segments.en: Yes, but I think you mostly use this when you're talking about women's underwear.
segments.cn: 是的，但我认为你主要在谈论女性内衣时使用这个词。

segments.en: I mean I don't know if I would say undies when I'm talking about men's underwear.
segments.cn: 我是说，当我谈论男性内裤时，我不知道我是否会说内衣。

segments.en: Alright, so we saw some of the different types of clothing, but now let's take a look at this interesting adjective.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们看了一些不同类型的衣服，但现在让我们看看这个有趣的形容词。

segments.en: Okay, so when something is mortifying.
segments.cn: 好的，当某事令人尴尬时。

segments.en: Well, I think we've got some examples to show you what that is like.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想我们有一些例子来展示这是什么样的。

segments.en: And then I fell in front of everyone.
segments.cn: 然后我在大家面前摔倒了。

segments.en: I was completely mortified when I realized what I had done.
segments.cn: 当我意识到我做了什么时，我感到非常尴尬。

segments.en: It must have been mortifying for her when she realized that her underwear was showing.
segments.cn: 当她意识到她的内裤露出来时，这一定是令人尴尬的。
所以基本上这非常尴尬。

segments.en: Alright, well, etymology here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 好吧，英语播客的词源学。

segments.en: Alright, so some interesting... Okay, so we saw the different types of underwear.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以一些有趣的……好的，所以我们看到了不同类型的内衣。

segments.en: We saw this really great word for when you're really embarrassed.
segments.cn: 我们看到了这个非常好的词，用于当你非常尴尬时。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at some of the phrases that you would use when you're really embarrassed in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看一些你在非常尴尬时会使用的短语，在流利构建中。

segments.en: Alright, well we have two phrases to look at here.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们这里有两个短语要看。

segments.en: Get the hell out of here.
Get the hell out of here.
Get the hell out of here.
Okay, so if I say I want to get the hell out of here.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果我说我想滚出这里。

segments.en: You want to leave this place really quickly.
segments.cn: 你想要非常快地离开这个地方。

segments.en: Now when you're using this phrase or this sentence, get the hell out of here, is it really polite?
segments.cn: 现在，当你使用这个短语或这个句子时，滚出这里，真的很礼貌吗？
好的，所以这真的很消极。
非常消极和非正式，对吧？

segments.en: So you would use this maybe with your friends or like in this case think it to yourself.
segments.cn: 所以你可能会在和朋友一起时使用这个，或者在这种情况下想想。

segments.en: Yes, but it's not a good idea to use with your boss or your mother.
segments.cn: 是的，但在你的老板或母亲面前使用这不是个好主意。

segments.en: Okay, I guess sometimes depending on the tone you use, how you say it, you can sound really angry, right?
segments.cn: 好的，我想有时根据你使用的语气，你说的方式，你可能听起来真的很生气，对吧？

segments.en: Alright, well let's listen to some examples.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们听一些例子。

segments.en: Let's get the hell out of here.
What are you doing in my house?
Get the hell out of here.
We're at a friend's party and all of a sudden her parents arrived.
segments.cn: 我们在朋友的派对上，突然她的父母来了。

segments.en: We got the hell out of there as quickly as possible.
Alright, so get the hell out of here.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以快点离开这里。

segments.en: Get the hell out of here.
Now let's take a look at our last phrase for Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看最后一个流利表达。

segments.en: I want to get this over with.
So you want to finish it really quickly.
But you want to finish it because you're not really enjoying it, right?
segments.cn: 但你想完成它，因为你并不享受，对吧？

segments.en: This is something that you use when the situation is negative.
segments.cn: 这是在负面情况下使用的表达。

segments.en: Okay, so I just want to get this over with.
Yeah, I want to get this test over with.
segments.cn: 是的，我想结束这个测试。

segments.en: I want to get this day over with.
I want to get this... Maybe if you're on a bad date I want to get this date over with.
segments.cn: 我想结束这个……也许如果你在一个糟糕的约会中，我想结束这个约会。

segments.en: Alright, well interesting phrases and I think it would help us to hear them once more in context in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，有趣的短语，我认为在对话中再听一遍会对我们有帮助。

segments.en: Okay, just find something and get out of here.
segments.cn: 好吧，快找点东西然后离开这里。

segments.en: Oh no, don't come over here.
Um, I'm just having a look around.

segments.cn: 明天是我女朋友的生日。

segments.en: I'm trying to find her something.
segments.cn: 我在试着给她找点东西。

segments.en: Well, you can't give her granny panties.
segments.cn: 好吧，你不能送她老奶奶的内裤。

segments.en: Have you thought about getting her some sleepwear?
segments.cn: 你有没有想过给她买睡衣？

segments.en: We've got these lovely silky nighties or how about some nice panties in a bra set?
segments.cn: 我们有这些可爱的丝质睡裙，或者一些漂亮的内裤和文胸套装？

segments.en: Look, here's a nice satin push-up bra and you can choose a few different styles of undies to go with it.
segments.cn: 看，这里有一款漂亮的缎面聚拢文胸，你可以选择几种不同风格的内裤搭配。

segments.en: Well, do you want a thong?
Maybe this nice pair of Lacy boy shorts?
segments.cn: 也许这条漂亮的蕾丝短裤？

segments.en: Just pick something and get the hell out of here.
segments.cn: 快点选点东西然后离开这里。

segments.en: Um, I'll go with these two.
I just want to get this over with and she better thank you for this.
segments.cn: 我只想结束这个，她最好为此感谢你。

segments.en: I'm going to have to take a look inside your bag.
segments.cn: 我需要检查一下你的包。

segments.en: All right, so I guess the situation is very common.
segments.cn: 好吧，我想这个情况很常见。

segments.en: Men either having to shop for this type of article for their girlfriend or wife because it's their birthday, or sometimes we get dragged into a store to buy this.
segments.cn: 男人们要为女朋友或妻子买这种东西，因为是她们的生日，或者有时我们被拖进商店买这个。

segments.en: So you're shopping with your girlfriend and she's gonna make you go look at underwear with her.
segments.cn: 所以你和女朋友一起购物，她会让你和她一起看内衣。

segments.en: Yeah, I usually don't do that though.
I will just go to the next section and just look around.
segments.cn: 我会去下一个区域随便看看。

segments.en: I have seen some men who go shopping with their girlfriends or wives and actually enjoy buying underwear.
segments.cn: 我见过一些和女朋友或妻子一起购物的男人，实际上享受买内衣。

segments.en: I think it makes sense, but I don't know how comfortable you would actually be.
segments.cn: 我觉得这很合理，但我不知道你会有多舒服。

segments.en: I guess just how it indicates sexuality and all this stuff.
segments.cn: 我想这只是因为它涉及性和这些东西。

segments.en: I could do it for maybe five or ten minutes, give my professional advice, and then I'm out of there.
segments.cn: 我可以做五到十分钟，给我专业的建议，然后我就走。

segments.en: All right, well maybe those guys who look like they're enjoying themselves are just really talking in their heads, telling themselves how much they hate this.
segments.cn: 好吧，也许那些看起来很享受的家伙其实是在心里告诉自己有多讨厌这个。

segments.en: Exactly, maybe they're just pretending or listening to their iPod.
segments.cn: 正是如此，也许他们只是在假装或听他们的iPod。

segments.en: Well tell us, well guys, I know we've got a lot of male listeners.
segments.cn: 好吧，告诉我们，伙计们，我知道我们有很多男性听众。

segments.en: Are you embarrassed by women's underwear?
segments.cn: 你们对女性内衣感到尴尬吗？

segments.en: Right, or women, why aren't you embarrassed when you buy men's underwear for your boyfriend or husband?
segments.cn: 对，或者女性，为什么你们在为男朋友或丈夫买男士内衣时不感到尴尬？

segments.en: I think there's a lot to talk about here, so come to our website at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我觉得这里有很多话要说，所以请访问我们的网站EnglishPod.com。
